entry.title: SFZ page on Italian Wikipedia
entry.content: A new page about the SFZ format has been added to the Italian Wikipedia. Let’s grow!

entry.title: Modulations Explained
entry.content: We have two new articles explaining the modulations possible in SFZ1 and SFZ2. Hopefully it will now be much easier to understand what’s possible under each spec level, and just what those complex SFZ2 LFOs and envelopes can and can’t do.

entry.title: New Tutorial
entry.content:
We’ve published a new tutorial explaining how to use samples to model brushed drum techniques which produce a continuous sound rather than a discrete hit. Admittedly, this is a rather niche technique not only in the samples world but also in real-world music, mainly used in jazz and some indie music. Next we plan to expand the vibrato tutorial, which is currently only a simple code example.

Minor updates:

  • global_label, master_label, group_label and region_label opcodes added.
  • Added Carla and Bliss Sampler to SFZ players, updated TAL Sampler info.

entry.title: New Website Launched
entry.content:
We’re proud to announce a new website!

  • Built on Jekyll.
  • Most content is authored in Markdown format.
  • Utilizes Bootstrap and SASS for easy skinning and responsive design, making the website available to mobile devices.
  • Utilizes FontAwesome and Favicon Generator for content and website icons.
